pdgm.pdgmnote: Appleyard1975 7.4 Agent noun marker sing. –änta plur. –äntə

Appleyard1975,p. 334 .This tense is a close compound of a subordinate form,which occasionally occurs outside this particular compound,and the imperfective affirmative of the verb wan- be. The first part of the compound has personal markers (set A),but zero tense marker;also,the marker -y of the 2nd person singular and the 3rd person feminine is often deleted.
Appleyard1975 7.4 Agent noun marker sing. –änta plur. –äntə

prop.val: are you getting used to it?

The first part of the compound has personal markers (set A),but zero tense marker;also,the marker -y of the 2nd person singular and the 3rd person feminine is often deleted.
